timeline.bodyText: Are we going for prefixing the inject methods with fabric and _? I am seeing mostly no prefix on inject, this is an inject so conflicting names shouldn't matter right?
timeline.author: shedaniel

replies.bodyText: The fabric_ prefix is also for exception stacktraces because VanillaClass.someMethod$onSomeMethod doesn't tell what mod caused the error, unlike fabric_onSomeMethod.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: We might want to have a standard in place for this, 99% of mixins have no prefix right now, we might want to refactor all of them if that's what we are going for.
replies.author: shedaniel

replies.bodyText: But that's a topic for another day, let's not bloat this thing
replies.author: shedaniel

replies.bodyText: That is actually an issue I brought up already #510
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Prefixes are not necessary on @Inject methods, since Mixin prepends special signature info onto each method. For MixinAbstractFurnaceBlockEntity's fuelTimeMapHook method, Mixin names it handler$zeh000$fuelTimeMapHook. It's also given a @MixinMerged annotation noting the mixin class that added the injection. If the fabric_ prefix here is because Mixin error handling doesn't expose the cause well enough, then we can just improve error handling on our Mixin fork. This method should just be named cacheScreenHandler.
replies.author: LemmaEOF

replies.bodyText: we should use prefix, though i personally prefer fabric$ prefix as _ looks too ugly
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: We should follow the standard in the rest of Fabric API or create a new PR to enforce the fabric$ prefix standard across the rest of the API. Renaming mixin methods is not breaking, so it can be done safely at any time. Stick with the API convention for now.
replies.author: LemmaEOF

replies.bodyText: There's no API convention, though. Fabric uses all of those different styles that i5 listed in #510.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: oh god, really? I could have sworn there was one already
replies.author: LemmaEOF

replies.bodyText:
I searched through some mixins and 99% of them have no prefix, the example in i5's issue for fabric_ is not an inject, most other fabric_ are overrides, the current majority is no prefix.
I am not saying that no prefix is the best style but mostly injects in fabric API have no prefixes right now, and we should stick to the masses until we have a PR to change this.
replies.author: shedaniel
